intro: Colea undulata, commonly known as the wavy colea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive wavy, undulating leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Colea undulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
